components.description:
A classic alien face. The oval, bare head of a gray or green alien with large black eyes and a slight, friendly smile. Samsung depicts nostrils, Facebook a nose.

May represent extraterrestrial life or topics concerning outer space, but commonly conveys a playful sense of weirdness or strangeness, as if someone or something is out there or from another planet.

Available as an Apple Animoji.

Apple previously displayed a similar looking alien head in a box as a placeholder for an unknown emoji, but now shows a boxed question mark.
components.title: Extraterrestrial Alien

description:
A classic alien face. The oval, bare head of a gray or green alien with large black eyes and a slight, friendly smile. Samsung depicts nostrils, Facebook a nose.

May represent extraterrestrial life or topics concerning outer space, but commonly conveys a playful sense of weirdness or strangeness, as if someone or something is out there or from another planet.

Available as an Apple Animoji.

Apple previously displayed a similar looking alien head in a box as a placeholder for an unknown emoji, but now shows a boxed question mark.
title: Extraterrestrial Alien

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Fairy tale symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: AnÂ extra terrestrial alien head, using theÂ stereotypical depiction of an alien with a bald head, large open eyes, and a mouth. iOS displays  http://emojipedia.org/extraterrestrial-alien/
emoji_net_data.name: alien

bn:00102076a: Suggesting the operation of supernatural influences- John Galsworthy- Henry Kingsley

bn:00103463a: Of or relating to a galaxy (especially our galaxy the Milky Way)
Relating to the galaxy or a galaxy.

bn:13698859a: Very large; worthy of a monster.

bn:00111281a: Being definitely out of the ordinary and unexpected; slightly odd or even a bit weird
Strange or unusual, often implying unpleasant.
Not normal; odd, unusual, surprising, out of the ordinary.

bn:00102654a: Originating from outside of the Earth's atmosphere, from space, or from another planet; alien to Earth or its environment.
Originating or located or occurring outside Earth or its atmosphere
Originating from outside of the Earth.
Originating, located, or occurring outside Earth or its atmosphere.

bn:13744591v: To behave as a monster to; to terrorise.

bn:00082447v: To disturb with fear; to throw into a state of alarm or fright; to affright; to terrify.

bn:00089239v: Follow stealthily or recur constantly and spontaneously to

bn:00032600n: Part of the body at the front of the head
The face is a central organ of sense and is also very central in the expression of emotion among humans and among numerous other species.
Faces are the central sense organ complexes, for those animals that have one, normally on the ventral surface of the head.
The front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear
The front part of the head, featuring the eyes, nose, and mouth and the surrounding area.

bn:00032763n: A story about fairies; told to amuse children
Fairy tales are a type of story which typically features fantasy characters, such as fairies, goblins, elves, trolls, dwarves, giants, mermaids, or gnomes, and usually magic or enchantments. tale

A fairy tale is a type of short story that typically features European folkloric fantasy characters, such as dwarves, elves, fairies, giants, gnomes, goblins, mermaids, trolls, or witches, and usually magic or enchantments.
A folktale featuring fairies or similar fantasy characters.
A fictional story that usually features folkloric characters (such as fairies, goblins, elves, trolls, witches, giants, and talking animals) and enchantments
Fictional story featuring folkloric fantasy characters

bn:01669238n: The literary genre generally dealing with themes of magic and fictive medieval technology.
Fantasy refers to constructs of the imagination; in storytelling Fantasy generally refers to a genre that uses magic and other supernatural forms as a primary element of plot, theme, and/or setting.
Fantasy is a genre of fiction that commonly uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary plot element, theme, or setting.
A genre of literature and art that uses magic and other supernatural forms as a primary element of plot and theme. The storyline is often set in a fictional, historically oriented setting.

bn:00036308n: A monstrous thing, person or act.
Someone or something that is markedly unusual.
A person or animal that is markedly unusual or deformed
In current usage, the word "freak" is commonly used to refer to a person with something strikingly unusual about their appearance or behavior.
Person or thing that is monstrous.

bn:00009663n: Behemoth is a beast mentioned in.
Any creature or thing of gigantic size.
Someone or something that is abnormally large and powerful
A great and mighty beast God shows Job in Job 40:15-24.
Any large person or thing; someone or something that is abnormally large or powerful.

bn:00002727n: Hypothetical Earth-sized planet orbiting a red dwarf star
Any life form of extraterrestrial origin.
A form of life assumed to exist outside the Earth or its atmosphere
Extraterrestrial life is life that does not originate from Earth.
In scientific context, hypothetical life that exists outside Earth
Aurelia and Blue Moon are hypothetical examples of a planet and a moon on which extraterrestrial life could evolve.
Life that does not originate from Earth

bn:00035528n: An (apparently) flying object whose nature is unknown; especially those considered to have extraterrestrial origins
Unidentified flying object is the popular term for any aerial phenomenon whose cause cannot be easily or immediately identified. flying object
A flying saucer is a type of described flying craft with a disc or saucer-shaped body, commonly used generically to refer to any anomalous flying object.
Unusual apparent anomaly in the sky that is not readily identifiable
An unusual apparent anomaly in the sky that is not readily identifiable to the observer as any known object
An unidentified flying object, or UFO, in its most general definition, is any apparent anomaly in the sky that is not identifiable as a known object or phenomenon.
An unidentified flying object; UFO; usually with disc-like properties.

bn:00059768n: Outer space, or simply just space, is the void that exists between celestial bodies, including the Earth.
The location of things that are "outside Earth"
The near-vacuum in which planets, stars and other celestial objects are situated; the universe beyond the earth's atmosphere.
Relatively empty regions (with very small densities) of the universe outside the atmospheres of celestial bodies.
Any location outside the Earth's atmosphere
